page.title: 14CHANGING FACE OF WOODINGDEAN
page.content: The Downs Hotel in Warren Road was built in 1927 as a public house.There were no shops in those days,only Ghazals,which was a small hut.People had to walk into Brighton to get clothes and basic items.Inthose days you had to walk 50ft. to go to the toilet.At night a big cart came around the houses and collected the sewage emptying it into a field.To get milk you had to take a can to West Farm.Underneath Fitzherbert School there is a very deep well which has been filled in.At the top of Batemans Road there were two Iron age skeletons.Woodingdean has changed a lot since those early days.Open fields have given way to factories and houses.More people have moved into the area but still it retains a certain remoteness from the rest of Brighton.
